results.title: The Delinquents
results.creator_credit: Village Roadshow Pictures, Silver Lining, Alex Cutler, Mike Wilcox and Chris Thomson
results.brief_description: Love story about two teenagers in 1950’s Australia whose passion and love for each other breaks not only the rules set down by their parents but also by society. Based on the novel of the same name by Criena Rohan. Stars Kylie Minogue and Charlie Schlatter with Bruno Lawrence, Todd Boyce, Desiree Smith, Melissa Jaffer, Angela Punch-McGregor.

results.title: The Delinquent, the hipster and the square
results.creator_credit: CBS Television, Jack Kuney and Tim Kiley
results.brief_description: A study of the dynamics of youth culture as expressed in dominant youth reactions to the world; rebellion, escape and uncritical acceptance. Each reaction is examined dramatically and the significance pointed out critically, yet sympathetically, by the narrator Dr. William Kirkland, late professor of Christian Ethics, McCormick Theological Seminary. Written by Elliot Baker. Starring Warren Berlinger as the square, William Hickey as the delinquent, Pat DeSimone as the girl, Mal Throne as the poet and the Max Roach Quinter.

results.title: The Delights of Turkey
results.creator_credit: Grainger Television Australia and Greg Grainger
results.brief_description: Filmmaker Greg Grainger journeys for 4,000 km around Western Turkey on a motorcycle. Beginning in Istanbul, home of the more liberal Turkish Muslims, we visit famous tourist venues such as the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and the magnificent Grant Bazaar. Travelling along the coast, we see the increasing numbers of young Australians making their pilgrimage to Gallipoli at Anzac Cove. Remains of Roman civilization and architecture are evident throughout Western Turkey and Greg’s group rides in a hot air balloon over the strange cave houses of Cappadocia. Traditional farming and carpet making in rural areas are shown as happily co-existing with the more modern tourist attractions of restaurants, belly dancing and shopping in the cities.

results.title: The Defiant ones
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation and Stanley Kramer
results.brief_description: Two convicts - one black, one white - escape across country chained together. Initially the yard of chain shackles two bitter enemies but gradually a bond grows between them. Dramatically and cinematically this is probably the most satisfying of Kramer’s “message” pictures but, although free of sentimentality and polemics, the notion of universal brotherhood is perhaps too simplistic to carry much conceptual interest. Winner of two Academy Awards (1958). Cast includes Tony Curtis and Sidney Poitier.

results.title: The Deer hunter [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, EMI/Parlophone, Barry Spikings, Michael Deeley, Michael Cimino and John Peverell
results.brief_description: The Deer hunter is a stunning epic exploration of the physical and psychological effects of the Vietnam War on three young working class men from a Pennsylvania steel town. The film is influenced by the sumptuous cinema of Visconti and Bertolluci, combining social observation with lavish tableaus of everyday life. From the opening wedding sequence to the nightmarish scenes in a prisoner of war camp, “The Deer Hunter” is a consistently astounding film that refuses to situate itself as either pro or anti War. Rather than tackling the specific history of the Vietnam war, it becomes instead a moving allegory on all war and on the destruction, it reaps on the psyches of both the victor and the conquered. “The Deer Hunter” won an Academy Award for Best Film and remains one of the best films ever made about war. With Robert De Niro, Christopher Walken, John Savage and Meryl Streep. The astonishing cinematography is by Vilmos Zsigmond.

results.title: The Decline of western civilization
results.brief_description: Documentary filmed December 1979 through May 1980 in Los Angeles, California on the hard-core punk rock culture movement that existed at the time. Features a cross-section of some of the prominent Los Angeles bands performing live on stage at The Arena, The Fleetwood, Club 88, Hong Kong Cafe and Cherrywood Studios, including Alice Bag Band, Black Flag, Catholic Discipline, Circle Jerks, Fear, Germs, and X. Also includes some insightful interviews with members of the bands, punk fans and music industry moguls as they discuss their lives, the punk phenomenon and their philosophy on life. WARNING: Contains strong use of language and some violent scenes.

results.title: The Decline of Tsarism
results.creator_credit: University of Warwick and Ian Thompson
results.brief_description: Using archival footage, this program studies the military defeats and growing social unrest that resulted in the 1917 abdication of Tzar Nicholas II, ending the Romanov dynasty in Russia.

results.title: The Decline of the Roman Empire
results.brief_description: Uses actual settings in France, England, the Near East and Rome to present the political, social and economic forces which weakened the Roman Empire from within and the forces from without which brought about its decline.
